titles.title: To provide for demonstration projects to test whether enrollment in the supplemental security income program can be significantly increased by offering nonprofit organizations financial incentives to engage in outreach.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E1393)
Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Human Resources.

bill.summary: 5/27/1993--Introduced. Directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to: (1) enter into contracts to provide for demonstration projects to test whether enrollment in the Supplemental Security Income program under title XVI of the Social Security Act can be significantly increased by offering private organizations financial incentives to engage in outreach; and (2) report to the Congress on the results of such projects.
